headline: Summer is no real break for Europe

headline: Balkan reform vital for EU entry – 1

headline: Balkan reform vital for EU entry – 2
description: The eventful Balkan spring of 2008 saw Kosovo peacefully gain independence, pro-European forces in Serbia trump the isolationist nationalist opposition in two consecutive elections, and all countries except Kosovo engage in stabilisation and association agreements with the EU. Some viewed these developments as evidence that the western Balkans were now irrevocably set on the path to Europe, and that the aggressive nationalism of the 1990s was a thing of the past. But the road to Brussels still has many pitfalls, and much depends on the strategy the EU adopts.

headline: What this financial crisis teaches us
description: The lessons of the West’s financial crisis are numerous, but the underlying one is that we should be more open-minded and commonsensical.

headline: Asian shoe imports benefit EU consumers and producers
description: A handful of European shoemakers are soon likely to request an extension of EU anti-dumping duties on leather footwear from Vietnam and China. But contrary to what your article may lead people into thinking (‘Shoemakers fight cheap imports’, 24-29 April), these producers do not speak in the interest of the majority of the European footwear industry, let alone European consumers.

headline: EU presses WTO to open China’s banking market
description: Wide concern over Chinese banking barriers; draft law may allow foreign stakes.

headline: Why central banks must take the lead
description: Central banks must step up to the plate and take a bigger role in financial regulation, however uncomfortable that may be for some.

headline: Commission wants to cut spending by €4bn
description: Commission wants to ‘green’ the budget; increase in spending on energy programmes.

headline: Slovakia set to adopt euro
description: Slovakia is likely to become the second former communist state to join the eurozone after receiving a green light from the European Commission.

description: Opportunism will continue to haunt the British economy.

headline: Eurozone inflation climbs to record high
description: Revised figures show retail prices rose by 3.6% year on year in March.

headline: EU budget surplus shrinks
description: European Commission continues to improve budget planning and management.

headline: Eurozone ‘needs’ more say in global economy
description: Commissioner believes eurozone should bolster its role in efforts to stabilise the global economy.

description: A former Romanian finance minister argues that tectonic shifts in the world economy and the tarnishing of the West’s business reputation should encourage it to pay genuine attention to the concerns of the rest of the world.

description: Central bank expresses fears about inflation, but maintains current rates in hope of calming markets.

headline: ECB keeps interest rates unchanged
description: Bank more concerned about inflation than the economy, and wards off talk of help for banks.

description: Finance ministers call for wage restraint, but unions are worried about migrating work and workers.

headline: Why the Rhineland model is still strong
description: Germany’s economic success will increase pressure on other EU member states to reform their economies.

headline: Paulson’s stress fails to rub off on Europe
description: National regulators to boost co-operation

headline: Economic development deals ‘may be revised’
description: Developing countries have the right to renegotiate interim economic partnership deals (EPAs) reached with the EU, according to the European Parliament’s legal service. The ruling puts the assembly on a collision course with the European Commission, which is refusing to entertain any possibility of revising them.

headline: EU shouldn’t wait for Americans to wise up
description: If the morning of 20 March had again seen branches of a leading British bank besieged by worried savers, the banking system and economy could have suffered a crippling blow.

headline: Kovács mulls reduced VAT on eco-products and nappies
description: Taxation commissioner considers changing VAT cuts despite ongoing legal action.

headline: The making of Ireland: more luck than management?
description: Bookshops in Ireland tend to carry a disproportionately large ‘Irish Interest’ section: rows of self-approving, sentimental offerings, which will be brought home and, unread, become the vertical equivalent of coffee table books.

headline: VAT bid flickers on energy-saving bulbs
description: The UK’s last-minute bid to win value-added tax (VAT) concessions for eco-friendly goods achieved no more than a vague promise that the idea would be explored by the European Commission.

headline: MEPs pile pressure on Kallas over EU funds
description: MEPs on the budgetary control committee have renewed their threat to delay approval of the EU’s 2006 accounts. They are demanding prior agreement from the Commission and member states to a 13-point list of improvements.

Galileo satellite system gets off the ground…just
description: EU transport ministers finally agreed last Friday (30 November) a plan to ensure the launch of the Galileo satellite navigation system in 2013, overcoming last-minute opposition from Spain.

headline: Europe Inc. needs more than economic mantras
description: For most economists ‘globalisation’ means simply faster trade integration and increasing cross-border flows of capital. Globalisation is unarguably an opportunity to consume more cheaply and therefore more. Yet not everyone is happy with a roller-coaster ride through increasingly commodified entertainment and fast, often bewildering, changes in the workplace.
